article.headline: Furman 77, Wofford 73
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. (AP) -- Maleye Ndoye hit the game-winning jumper with 1.5 seconds left as Furman beat Wofford 77-73 on Saturday night. Ndoye led all scorers with 25 points, while Quan Prowell scored 14 and Tony Carter added 11 for the Paladins (13-10, 5-7 Southern Conference). Howard Wilkerson led the Terriers (8-16, 4-9) with 19 points. Wilkerson's free throw with 1:21 left tied the game at 73 and neither team scored on its next possession before Ndoye's 15-footer gave Furman the lead at 77-73. Wofford's inbounds pass went out of bounds. The Terries then fouled Carter who hit both free throws for the final margin. The Paladins shot 52.1 percent (25-of-48) for the game, and 68.2 percent (15-of-22) in the second half. Ndoye was 8-for-12 from the field and hit six of his eight free throws.
